src.game
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  src.game.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class to keep track of a player in the world. Will record location and current stats along with the methods that can be performed on the player.

Author:
Darren Watts date 11/11/07
See Also:
Serialized Form

public Player(java.lang.String name,
              int hp,
              int fightAbil,
              int marksAbil,
              int martsAbil,
              int thievAbil,
              int mon)
       throws NoSuchCityException
Creates a player object.

Parameters:
name - String : name of the player
hp - int : hit points
fightAbil - int : fighting ability
marksAbil - int : marksmanship ability
martsAbil - int : martial arts ability
thievAbil - int : thieving ability
mon - int : money
Throws:
NoSuchCityException

move

public void move(Direction direction)
          throws PlayerEnteredException,
                 EnemyDiedException
If the player can move, it will call the enter method of the land, update the player facing direction, and trigger a world update.

Parameters:
direction - Direction to move as a String.
Throws:
PlayerEnteredException
EnemyDiedException

updateFacing

public void updateFacing(Direction direction)
Updates the player's facing direction based on the movement direction given. It will act differently depending on if the palyer is in a dungeon or not.

Parameters:
direction - Direction : movement direction

pass

public void pass()
Called when the player decides to take a turn without moving. This will increase the player's minimum health by 2 hitpoints and trigger a world upate. There is also a chance that a new enemy will spawn.

attack

public void attack(Enemy enemy)
            throws EnemyDiedException
Player will attack the enemy specified.

Parameters:
enemy - The enemy to attack.
Throws:
EnemyDiedException

drainLife

public void drainLife(int num)
Drains the life of the player. If the player dies, end the game.

Parameters:
num - The number of hitpoints the player's health should drop by.

heal

public void heal(int amount)
Heals the player the desired amount as long as the minimum hit points are below the maximum.

Parameters:
amount - Number of hit points to heal the player by.

decrementHitCounter

public void decrementHitCounter()
If the hit counter is currently active, it will decrease it by one. If after the decrease, the hit counter is 0, it will set the justHit variable to false.
